name: Idiopathic Systemic Capillary Leak Syndrome
chief_complaint: Recurrent episodes of severe swelling, weakness, and low blood pressure
prognosis: Guarded; recurrent episodes carry high mortality risk (30-40% in first 5 years)
description: A rare, life-threatening condition characterized by recurrent episodes of capillary hyperpermeability leading to massive fluid shifts from intravascular to extravascular space. Episodes often preceded by viral illness. Diagnosis requires exclusion of other causes of capillary leak.
